channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 300 civilians evacuated from Mariupol after Russia opens humanitarian corridors
item.description: More than 300 civilians were evacuated from the ruined Ukrainian port city of Mariupol and the surrounding areas on Wednesday, the Red Cross has said.
item.media:description: Smoke rises above a plant of Azovstal Iron and Steel Works company during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the southern port city of Mariupol, Ukraine April 20, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko

item.title: Briton in controversial Ukrainian military unit prepared to spend year fighting Russia
item.description: A British man who joined a controversial Ukrainian military unit says he is willing is spend the next year defending against Russia's invasion - and he has not been deterred by the capture of other Britons.

item.title: Russia accused of targeting hospitals in 'terror bombing' campaign
item.description: Almost four attacks a day have been carried out against medics and healthcare facilities in Ukraine on average since the war began, according to Sky News analysis.

item.title: British Virgin Islands premier to plead not guilty to drug trafficking charges, his lawyer says
item.description: The premier of the British Virgin Islands, who is accused of money laundering and conspiring to import cocaine, will plead not guilty to drug trafficking, his lawyer has said.
item.media:description: Premier of the Virgin Islands, Honourable Andrew A. Fahie met with Minister for Overseas Territories The Right Honourable Amanda Milling, MP. The important ministerial bilateral meeting presented an opportunity for the Premier and Minister of Finance to meet with the new OT Minister on Virgin Islands-specific matters.

item.title: Heartbreak for Manchester City as Real Madrid stage late comeback to knock Guardiola's side out of Champions League
item.description: Manchester City have been knocked out of the Champions League by Real Madrid after conceding two goals in the dying seconds of the game.
item.media:description: Soccer Football - Champions League - Semi Final - Second Leg - Real Madrid v Manchester City - Santiago Bernabeu, Madrid, Spain - May 4, 2022 Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola Action Images via Reuters/Carl Recine TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY

item.title: Diego Maradona's 'Hand of God' shirt sets new auction record for sports memorabilia
item.description: The shirt worn by Diego Maradona when he scored two of the world's most memorable goals, to knock England out of the 1986 World Cup, has been sold for more than £7m at auction.
item.media:description: Diego Maradona and Peter Shilton. Pic: Rex/Shutterstock

item.title: 'Putin must pay a price': EU plans Russian oil ban by the end of the year in new package of sanctions
item.description: The European Union has announced plans to ban Russian oil by the end of the year as part of a sixth package of sanctions in response to the war in Ukraine.
item.media:description: 02 May 2022, Brandenburg, Schwedt: Surplus gas is burned on the industrial site of PCK-Raffinerie GmbH. Crude oil from Russia arrives at the PCK petroleum refinery in Schwedt via the "Friendship" pipeline. Last year, the Russian energy group Rosneft took over a large part of the PCK petroleum refinery in Schwedt. Rosneft is Russia's largest oil producer. According to its own information, the refinery in the Uckermark region processes 12 million tons of crude oil annually, making it one of the la

item.title: North Korea fires ballistic missile into sea off its east coast, says Japan and South Korea
item.description: Days after Kim Jong Un vowed to bolster his nuclear arsenal "at the fastest possible pace", North Korea has reportedly launched a ballistic missile.
item.media:description: Kim Jong Un applauds during a photo session with students and young workers in Pyongyang

item.title: Fiji court rules US can seize $325m superyacht believed to be owned by Russian oligarch
item.description: A judge in Fiji has ruled that US authorities can seize a Russian-owned superyacht worth $325m (£260m).
item.media:description:
Boat captain Emosi Dawai looks at the superyacht Amadea where it is docked at the Queens Wharf in Lautoka, Fiji, on April 13, 2022. A judge in Fiji is due to rule Monday, May 2, 2022, on whether U.S. authorities can seize the luxurious yacht — worth some $325 million — which has been stopped from leaving the South Pacific nation because of its links to Russia. (Leon Lord/Fiji Sun via AP)
PIC:AP

item.title: Archaeologists discover 1,000-year-old 'hand grenade'
item.description: Archaeologists have analysed residues from the internal surface of an ancient ceramic shard to discover it likely belonged to a 1,000-year-old hand grenade.
item.media:description: The ceramic hand grenade could date back to the 11th Century. Pic: D. Matheson
